The Star newspaper reported Thursday that Mandla Mandela had been seen by a lung specialist at the private hospital. He has been admitted for investigation, the doctor, Michael Gove Plit, told the newspaper. He declined to comment on Mandla Mandela 's condition. Shadow education secretary Andy Burnham said it was a "damning verdict" which raised doubts about the education secretary's "competence and judgment" . Mr Andy Burnham said the High Court had ruled Mr Michael Gove was guilty of an abuse of power and there had not been "one word of apology" from the secretary of state. He said Mr Michael Gove "should now remove himself from any further part in this decision" . The BBC
